summary: Edward M. Evans was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978, August 1978, and December 1978. The documents list his name, salary, and pay during those periods, indicating he was a staff member during that time frame.
significance: Edward M. Evans' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
